abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Municipal Services
            Project for Romania is to directly improve the quality of
            water and wastewater services and reduce flooding of low
            lying city areas where new drainage networks will be built.
            Negative impacts of the project include: acquisition of
            agricultural land and meadow land, affect on buildings, loss
            of standing crops, loss of trees, and loss of other assets.
            Mitigation measures include: 1) cash compensation for
            affected land that it is equal to the replacement cost of
            the lost asset; 2) rehabilitation assistance such as job
            placement, skills training and/or use of alternative
            land/property to re-establish use such as grazing; 3) cash
            compensation for the assets at their replacement value plus
            assistance comprising costs of shifting, allowance until
            first harvest, cash compensation, job placement, or job
            training, transition allowance etc; 4) cash compensation for
            entire structure and other fixed assets without
            depreciation; 5) cash compensation equivalent to the market
            value for the affected crops; and 6) cash compensation for
            any assets affected.
